attributes.action: to ask the Rt Hon Lord Andrew Adonis, Secretary of State for Transport to consider getting the road intersection of the A406, North Circular Road, with the A1000, in Finchley named as the Green Man junction.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Most of the other juntions of the North Circular Road already have names, which are displayed above the road sign. This enables clear location advice in traffic reports, maps and Sat Nav screens.
The A406/A1000 intersection is not named, and would be in memory of the historic Green Man pub that stood on the site, and in recognition of the Green Man Community Centre that now stands there.
Geographically, these roads pass through what was Finchley Common, with all the myths and legends associated with the Green Man of the forest.
This is not just a local authority issue, as too many organisations are involved because of the different classes of road.  This request needs a top down approach to enable everyone involved to get this name approved.
